56static char *client_addr = NULL;

58/* input and output queue */
59struct sshbuf *iqueue;

65/* SSH2_FXP_INIT received */
66static int init_done;

68/* Disable writes */
69static int readonly;

71/* Requests that are allowed/denied */
72static char *request_whitelist, *request_blacklist;

74/* portable attributes, etc. */
75typedef struct Stat Stat;
76
77struct Stat {
78 char *name;
79 char *long_name;
80 Attrib attrib;
81};

83/* Packet handlers */
84static void process_open(u_int32_t id);
85static void process_close(u_int32_t id);
86static void process_read(u_int32_t id);
87static void process_write(u_int32_t id);
88static void process_stat(u_int32_t id);
89static void process_lstat(u_int32_t id);
90static void process_fstat(u_int32_t id);
91static void process_setstat(u_int32_t id);
92static void process_fsetstat(u_int32_t id);
93static void process_opendir(u_int32_t id);
94static void process_readdir(u_int32_t id);
95static void process_remove(u_int32_t id);
96static void process_mkdir(u_int32_t id);
97static void process_rmdir(u_int32_t id);
98static void process_realpath(u_int32_t id);
99static void process_rename(u_int32_t id);
100static void process_readlink(u_int32_t id);
101static void process_symlink(u_int32_t id);
102static void process_extended_posix_rename(u_int32_t id);
103static void process_extended_statvfs(u_int32_t id);
104static void process_extended_fstatvfs(u_int32_t id);
105static void process_extended_hardlink(u_int32_t id);
106static void process_extended_fsync(u_int32_t id);
107static void process_extended_lsetstat(u_int32_t id);
108static void process_extended(u_int32_t id);
109
110struct sftp_handler {
111 const char *name; /* user-visible name for fine-grained perms */
112 const char *ext_name; /* extended request name */
113 u_int type; /* packet type, for non extended packets */
114 void (*handler)(u_int32_t);
115 int does_write; /* if nonzero, banned for readonly mode */
116};
117
118static const struct sftp_handler handlers[] = {
119 /* NB. SSH2_FXP_OPEN does the readonly check in the handler itself */
120 { "open", NULL, SSH2_FXP_OPEN, process_open, 0 },
121 { "close", NULL, SSH2_FXP_CLOSE, process_close, 0 },
122 { "read", NULL, SSH2_FXP_READ, process_read, 0 },
123 { "write", NULL, SSH2_FXP_WRITE, process_write, 1 },
124 { "lstat", NULL, SSH2_FXP_LSTAT, process_lstat, 0 },
125 { "fstat", NULL, SSH2_FXP_FSTAT, process_fstat, 0 },
126 { "setstat", NULL, SSH2_FXP_SETSTAT, process_setstat, 1 },
127 { "fsetstat", NULL, SSH2_FXP_FSETSTAT, process_fsetstat, 1 },
128 { "opendir", NULL, SSH2_FXP_OPENDIR, process_opendir, 0 },
129 { "readdir", NULL, SSH2_FXP_READDIR, process_readdir, 0 },
130 { "remove", NULL, SSH2_FXP_REMOVE, process_remove, 1 },
131 { "mkdir", NULL, SSH2_FXP_MKDIR, process_mkdir, 1 },
132 { "rmdir", NULL, SSH2_FXP_RMDIR, process_rmdir, 1 },
133 { "realpath", NULL, SSH2_FXP_REALPATH, process_realpath, 0 },
134 { "stat", NULL, SSH2_FXP_STAT, process_stat, 0 },
135 { "rename", NULL, SSH2_FXP_RENAME, process_rename, 1 },
136 { "readlink", NULL, SSH2_FXP_READLINK, process_readlink, 0 },
137 { "symlink", NULL, SSH2_FXP_SYMLINK, process_symlink, 1 },
138 { NULL, NULL, 0, NULL, 0 }
139};
140
141/* SSH2_FXP_EXTENDED submessages */
142static const struct sftp_handler extended_handlers[] = {
143 { "posix-rename", "posix-rename@openssh.com", 0,
144 process_extended_posix_rename, 1 },
145 { "statvfs", "statvfs@openssh.com", 0, process_extended_statvfs, 0 },
146 { "fstatvfs", "fstatvfs@openssh.com", 0, process_extended_fstatvfs, 0 },
147 { "hardlink", "hardlink@openssh.com", 0, process_extended_hardlink, 1 },
148 { "fsync", "fsync@openssh.com", 0, process_extended_fsync, 1 },
149 { "lsetstat", "lsetstat@openssh.com", 0, process_extended_lsetstat, 1 },
150 { NULL, NULL, 0, NULL, 0 }
151};
152
153static int
154request_permitted(const struct sftp_handler *h)
155{
156 char *result;
157
158 if (readonly && h->does_write) {
159 verbose("Refusing %s request in read-only mode", h->name);
160 return 0;
161 }
162 if (request_blacklist != NULL &&
163 ((result = match_list(h->name, request_blacklist, NULL))) != NULL) {
164 free(result);
165 verbose("Refusing blacklisted %s request", h->name);
166 return 0;
167 }
168 if (request_whitelist != NULL &&
169 ((result = match_list(h->name, request_whitelist, NULL))) != NULL) {
170 free(result);
171 debug2("Permitting whitelisted %s request", h->name);
172 return 1;
173 }
174 if (request_whitelist != NULL) {
175 verbose("Refusing non-whitelisted %s request", h->name);
176 return 0;
177 }
178 return 1;
179}
180
181static int
182errno_to_portable(int unixerrno)
183{
184 int ret = 0;
185
186 switch (unixerrno) {
187 case 0:
188 ret = SSH2_FX_OK;
189 break;
190 case ENOENT:
191 case ENOTDIR:
192 case EBADF:
193 case ELOOP:
194 ret = SSH2_FX_NO_SUCH_FILE;
195 break;
196 case EPERM:
197 case EACCES:
198 case EFAULT:
199 ret = SSH2_FX_PERMISSION_DENIED;
200 break;
201 case ENAMETOOLONG:
202 case EINVAL:
203 ret = SSH2_FX_BAD_MESSAGE;
204 break;
205 case ENOSYS:
206 ret = SSH2_FX_OP_UNSUPPORTED;
207 break;
208 default:
209 ret = SSH2_FX_FAILURE;
210 break;
211 }
212 return ret;
213}
214
215static int
216flags_from_portable(int pflags)
217{
218 int flags = 0;
219
220 if ((pflags & SSH2_FXF_READ) &&
221 (pflags & SSH2_FXF_WRITE)) {
222 flags = O_RDWR;
223 } else if (pflags & SSH2_FXF_READ) {
224 flags = O_RDONLY;
225 } else if (pflags & SSH2_FXF_WRITE) {
226 flags = O_WRONLY;
227 }
228 if (pflags & SSH2_FXF_APPEND)
229 flags |= O_APPEND;
230 if (pflags & SSH2_FXF_CREAT)
231 flags |= O_CREAT;
232 if (pflags & SSH2_FXF_TRUNC)
233 flags |= O_TRUNC;
234 if (pflags & SSH2_FXF_EXCL)
235 flags |= O_EXCL;
236 return flags;
237}
238
239static const char *
240string_from_portable(int pflags)
241{
242 static char ret[128];
243
244 *ret = '\0';
245
246#define PAPPEND(str) { \
247 if (*ret != '\0') \
248 strlcat(ret, ",", sizeof(ret)); \
249 strlcat(ret, str, sizeof(ret)); \
250 }
251
252 if (pflags & SSH2_FXF_READ)
253 PAPPEND("READ")
254 if (pflags & SSH2_FXF_WRITE)
255 PAPPEND("WRITE")
256 if (pflags & SSH2_FXF_APPEND)
257 PAPPEND("APPEND")
258 if (pflags & SSH2_FXF_CREAT)
259 PAPPEND("CREATE")
260 if (pflags & SSH2_FXF_TRUNC)
261 PAPPEND("TRUNCATE")
262 if (pflags & SSH2_FXF_EXCL)
263 PAPPEND("EXCL")
264
265 return ret;
266}
267
268/* handle handles */
269
270typedef struct Handle Handle;
271struct Handle {
272 int use;
273 DIR *dirp;
274 int fd;
275 int flags;
276 char *name;
277 u_int64_t bytes_read, bytes_write;
278 int next_unused;
279};
280
281enum {
282 HANDLE_UNUSED,
283 HANDLE_DIR,
284 HANDLE_FILE
285};
286
287static Handle *handles = NULL;
288static u_int num_handles = 0;
289static int first_unused_handle = -1;
290
291static void handle_unused(int i)
292{
293 handles[i].use = HANDLE_UNUSED;
294 handles[i].next_unused = first_unused_handle;
295 first_unused_handle = i;
296}
297
298static int
299handle_new(int use, const char *name, int fd, int flags, DIR *dirp)
300{
301 int i;
302
303 if (first_unused_handle == -1) {
304 if (num_handles + 1 <= num_handles)
305 return -1;
306 num_handles++;
307 handles = xreallocarray(handles, num_handles, sizeof(Handle));
308 handle_unused(num_handles - 1);
309 }
310
311 i = first_unused_handle;
312 first_unused_handle = handles[i].next_unused;
313
314 handles[i].use = use;
315 handles[i].dirp = dirp;
316 handles[i].fd = fd;
317 handles[i].flags = flags;
318 handles[i].name = xstrdup(name);
319 handles[i].bytes_read = handles[i].bytes_write = 0;
320
321 return i;
322}
323
324static int
325handle_is_ok(int i, int type)
326{
327 return i >= 0 && (u_int)i < num_handles && handles[i].use == type;
328}
329
330static int
331handle_to_string(int handle, u_char **stringp, int *hlenp)
332{
333 if (stringp == NULL || hlenp == NULL)
334 return -1;
335 *stringp = xmalloc(sizeof(int32_t));
336 put_u32(*stringp, handle);
337 *hlenp = sizeof(int32_t);
338 return 0;
339}
340
341static int
342handle_from_string(const u_char *handle, u_int hlen)
343{
344 int val;
345
346 if (hlen != sizeof(int32_t))
347 return -1;
348 val = get_u32(handle);
349 if (handle_is_ok(val, HANDLE_FILE) ||
350 handle_is_ok(val, HANDLE_DIR))
351 return val;
352 return -1;
353}
354
355static char *
356handle_to_name(int handle)
357{
358 if (handle_is_ok(handle, HANDLE_DIR)||
359 handle_is_ok(handle, HANDLE_FILE))
360 return handles[handle].name;
361 return NULL;
362}
363
364static DIR *
365handle_to_dir(int handle)
366{
367 if (handle_is_ok(handle, HANDLE_DIR))
368 return handles[handle].dirp;
369 return NULL;
370}
371
372static int
373handle_to_fd(int handle)
374{
375 if (handle_is_ok(handle, HANDLE_FILE))
376 return handles[handle].fd;
377 return -1;
378}
379
380static int
381handle_to_flags(int handle)
382{
383 if (handle_is_ok(handle, HANDLE_FILE))
384 return handles[handle].flags;
385 return 0;
386}
387
388static void
389handle_update_read(int handle, ssize_t bytes)
390{
391 if (handle_is_ok(handle, HANDLE_FILE) && bytes > 0)
392 handles[handle].bytes_read += bytes;
393}
394
395static void
396handle_update_write(int handle, ssize_t bytes)
397{
398 if (handle_is_ok(handle, HANDLE_FILE) && bytes > 0)
399 handles[handle].bytes_write += bytes;
400}
401
402static u_int64_t
403handle_bytes_read(int handle)
404{
405 if (handle_is_ok(handle, HANDLE_FILE))
406 return (handles[handle].bytes_read);
407 return 0;
408}
409
410static u_int64_t
411handle_bytes_write(int handle)
412{
413 if (handle_is_ok(handle, HANDLE_FILE))
414 return (handles[handle].bytes_write);
415 return 0;
416}
417
418static int
419handle_close(int handle)
420{
421 int ret = -1;
422
423 if (handle_is_ok(handle, HANDLE_FILE)) {
424 ret = close(handles[handle].fd);
425 free(handles[handle].name);
426 handle_unused(handle);
427 } else if (handle_is_ok(handle, HANDLE_DIR)) {
428 ret = closedir(handles[handle].dirp);
429 free(handles[handle].name);
430 handle_unused(handle);
431 } else {
432 errno = ENOENT;
433 }
434 return ret;
435}
436
437static void
438handle_log_close(int handle, const char *emsg)
439{
440 if (handle_is_ok(handle, HANDLE_FILE)) {
441 logit("%s%sclose \"%s\" bytes read %llu written %llu",
442 emsg == NULL ? "" : emsg, emsg == NULL ? "" : " ",
443 handle_to_name(handle),
444 (unsigned long long)handle_bytes_read(handle),
445 (unsigned long long)handle_bytes_write(handle));
446 } else {
447 logit("%s%sclosedir \"%s\"",
448 emsg == NULL ? "" : emsg, emsg == NULL ? "" : " ",
449 handle_to_name(handle));
450 }
451}
452
453static void
454handle_log_exit(void)
455{
456 u_int i;
457
458 for (i = 0; i < num_handles; i++)
459 if (handles[i].use != HANDLE_UNUSED)
460 handle_log_close(i, "forced");
461}
462
463static int
464get_handle(struct sshbuf *queue, int *hp)
465{
466 u_char *handle;
467 int r;
468 size_t hlen;
469
470 *hp = -1;
471 if ((r = sshbuf_get_string(queue, &handle, &hlen)) != 0)
472 return r;
473 if (hlen < 256)
474 *hp = handle_from_string(handle, hlen);
475 free(handle);
476 return 0;
477}
478
479/* send replies */
480
481static void
482send_msg(struct sshbuf *m)
483{
484 int r;
485
486 if ((r = sshbuf_put_stringb(oqueue, m)) != 0)
487 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
488 sshbuf_reset(m);
489}
490
491static const char *
492status_to_message(u_int32_t status)
493{
494 const char *status_messages[] = {
495 "Success", /* SSH_FX_OK */
496 "End of file", /* SSH_FX_EOF */
497 "No such file", /* SSH_FX_NO_SUCH_FILE */
498 "Permission denied", /* SSH_FX_PERMISSION_DENIED */
499 "Failure", /* SSH_FX_FAILURE */
500 "Bad message", /* SSH_FX_BAD_MESSAGE */
501 "No connection", /* SSH_FX_NO_CONNECTION */
502 "Connection lost", /* SSH_FX_CONNECTION_LOST */
503 "Operation unsupported", /* SSH_FX_OP_UNSUPPORTED */
504 "Unknown error" /* Others */
505 };
506 return (status_messages[MINIMUM(status,SSH2_FX_MAX)]);
507}
508
509static void
510send_status(u_int32_t id, u_int32_t status)
511{
512 struct sshbuf *msg;
513 int r;
514
515 debug3("request %u: sent status %u", id, status);
516 if (log_level > SYSLOG_LEVEL_VERBOSE ||
517 (status != SSH2_FX_OK && status != SSH2_FX_EOF))
518 logit("sent status %s", status_to_message(status));
519 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
520 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
521 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, SSH2_FXP_STATUS)) != 0 ||
522 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, id)) != 0 ||
523 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, status)) != 0)
524 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
525 if (version >= 3) {
526 if ((r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg,
527 status_to_message(status))) != 0 ||
528 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, "")) != 0)
529 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
530 }
531 send_msg(msg);
532 sshbuf_free(msg);
533}
534static void
535send_data_or_handle(char type, u_int32_t id, const u_char *data, int dlen)
536{
537 struct sshbuf *msg;
538 int r;
539
540 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
541 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
542 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, type)) != 0 ||
543 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, id)) != 0 ||
544 (r = sshbuf_put_string(msg, data, dlen)) != 0)
545 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
546 send_msg(msg);
547 sshbuf_free(msg);
548}
549
550static void
551send_data(u_int32_t id, const u_char *data, int dlen)
552{
553 debug("request %u: sent data len %d", id, dlen);
554 send_data_or_handle(SSH2_FXP_DATA, id, data, dlen);
555}
556
557static void
558send_handle(u_int32_t id, int handle)
559{
560 u_char *string;
561 int hlen;
562
563 handle_to_string(handle, &string, &hlen);
564 debug("request %u: sent handle handle %d", id, handle);
565 send_data_or_handle(SSH2_FXP_HANDLE, id, string, hlen);
566 free(string);
567}
568
569static void
570send_names(u_int32_t id, int count, const Stat *stats)
571{
572 struct sshbuf *msg;
573 int i, r;
574
575 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
576 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
577 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, SSH2_FXP_NAME)) != 0 ||
578 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, id)) != 0 ||
579 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, count)) != 0)
580 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
581 debug("request %u: sent names count %d", id, count);
582 for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
583 if ((r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, stats[i].name)) != 0 ||
584 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, stats[i].long_name)) != 0 ||
585 (r = encode_attrib(msg, &stats[i].attrib)) != 0)
586 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
587 }
588 send_msg(msg);
589 sshbuf_free(msg);
590}
591
592static void
593send_attrib(u_int32_t id, const Attrib *a)
594{
595 struct sshbuf *msg;
596 int r;
597
598 debug("request %u: sent attrib have 0x%x", id, a->flags);
599 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
600 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
601 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, SSH2_FXP_ATTRS)) != 0 ||
602 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, id)) != 0 ||
603 (r = encode_attrib(msg, a)) != 0)
604 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
605 send_msg(msg);
606 sshbuf_free(msg);
607}
608
609static void
610send_statvfs(u_int32_t id, struct statvfs *st)
611{
612 struct sshbuf *msg;
613 u_int64_t flag;
614 int r;
615
616 flag = (st->f_flag & ST_RDONLY) ? SSH2_FXE_STATVFS_ST_RDONLY : 0;
617 flag |= (st->f_flag & ST_NOSUID) ? SSH2_FXE_STATVFS_ST_NOSUID : 0;
618
619 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
620 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
621 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, SSH2_FXP_EXTENDED_REPLY)) != 0 ||
622 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, id)) != 0 ||
623 (r = sshbuf_put_u64(msg, st->f_bsize)) != 0 ||
624 (r = sshbuf_put_u64(msg, st->f_frsize)) != 0 ||
625 (r = sshbuf_put_u64(msg, st->f_blocks)) != 0 ||
626 (r = sshbuf_put_u64(msg, st->f_bfree)) != 0 ||
627 (r = sshbuf_put_u64(msg, st->f_bavail)) != 0 ||
628 (r = sshbuf_put_u64(msg, st->f_files)) != 0 ||
629 (r = sshbuf_put_u64(msg, st->f_ffree)) != 0 ||
630 (r = sshbuf_put_u64(msg, st->f_favail)) != 0 ||
631 (r = sshbuf_put_u64(msg, st->f_fsid)) != 0 ||
632 (r = sshbuf_put_u64(msg, flag)) != 0 ||
633 (r = sshbuf_put_u64(msg, st->f_namemax)) != 0)
634 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
635 send_msg(msg);
636 sshbuf_free(msg);
637}
638
639/* parse incoming */
640
641static void
642process_init(void)
643{
644 struct sshbuf *msg;
645 int r;
646
647 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u32(iqueue, &version)) != 0)
648 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
649 verbose("received client version %u", version);
650 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
651 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
652 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, SSH2_FXP_VERSION)) != 0 ||
653 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, SSH2_FILEXFER_VERSION)) != 0 ||
654 /* POSIX rename extension */
655 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, "posix-rename@openssh.com")) != 0 ||
656 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, "1")) != 0 || /* version */
657 /* statvfs extension */
658 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, "statvfs@openssh.com")) != 0 ||
659 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, "2")) != 0 || /* version */
660 /* fstatvfs extension */
661 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, "fstatvfs@openssh.com")) != 0 ||
662 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, "2")) != 0 || /* version */
663 /* hardlink extension */
664 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, "hardlink@openssh.com")) != 0 ||
665 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, "1")) != 0 || /* version */
666 /* fsync extension */
667 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, "fsync@openssh.com")) != 0 ||
668 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, "1")) != 0 || /* version */
669 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, "lsetstat@openssh.com")) != 0 ||
670 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, "1")) != 0) /* version */
671 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
672 send_msg(msg);
673 sshbuf_free(msg);
674}
675
676static void
677process_open(u_int32_t id)
678{
679 u_int32_t pflags;
680 Attrib a;
681 char *name;
682 int r, handle, fd, flags, mode, status = SSH2_FX_FAILURE;
683
684 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(iqueue, &name, NULL)) != 0 ||
685 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(iqueue, &pflags)) != 0 || /* portable flags */
686 (r = decode_attrib(iqueue, &a)) != 0)
687 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
688
689 debug3("request %u: open flags %d", id, pflags);
690 flags = flags_from_portable(pflags);
691 mode = (a.flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_PERMISSIONS) ? a.perm : 0666;
692 logit("open \"%s\" flags %s mode 0%o",
693 name, string_from_portable(pflags), mode);
694 if (readonly &&
695 ((flags & O_ACCMODE) != O_RDONLY ||
696 (flags & (O_CREAT|O_TRUNC)) != 0)) {
697 verbose("Refusing open request in read-only mode");
698 status = SSH2_FX_PERMISSION_DENIED;
699 } else {
700 fd = open(name, flags, mode);
701 if (fd < 0) {
702 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
703 } else {
704 handle = handle_new(HANDLE_FILE, name, fd, flags, NULL);
705 if (handle < 0) {
706 close(fd);
707 } else {
708 send_handle(id, handle);
709 status = SSH2_FX_OK;
710 }
711 }
712 }
713 if (status != SSH2_FX_OK)
714 send_status(id, status);
715 free(name);
716}
717
718static void
719process_close(u_int32_t id)
720{
721 int r, handle, ret, status = SSH2_FX_FAILURE;
722
723 if ((r = get_handle(iqueue, &handle)) != 0)
724 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
725
726 debug3("request %u: close handle %u", id, handle);
727 handle_log_close(handle, NULL);
728 ret = handle_close(handle);
729 status = (ret == -1) ? errno_to_portable(errno) : SSH2_FX_OK;
730 send_status(id, status);
731}
732
733static void
734process_read(u_int32_t id)
735{
736 u_char buf[64*1024];
737 u_int32_t len;
738 int r, handle, fd, ret, status = SSH2_FX_FAILURE;
739 u_int64_t off;
740
741 if ((r = get_handle(iqueue, &handle)) != 0 ||
742 (r = sshbuf_get_u64(iqueue, &off)) != 0 ||
743 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(iqueue, &len)) != 0)
744 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
745
746 debug("request %u: read \"%s\" (handle %d) off %llu len %d",
747 id, handle_to_name(handle), handle, (unsigned long long)off, len);
748 if (len > sizeof buf) {
749 len = sizeof buf;
750 debug2("read change len %d", len);
751 }
752 fd = handle_to_fd(handle);
753 if (fd >= 0) {
754 if (lseek(fd, off, SEEK_SET) < 0) {
755 error("process_read: seek failed");
756 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
757 } else {
758 ret = read(fd, buf, len);
759 if (ret < 0) {
760 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
761 } else if (ret == 0) {
762 status = SSH2_FX_EOF;
763 } else {
764 send_data(id, buf, ret);
765 status = SSH2_FX_OK;
766 handle_update_read(handle, ret);
767 }
768 }
769 }
770 if (status != SSH2_FX_OK)
771 send_status(id, status);
772}
773
774static void
775process_write(u_int32_t id)
776{
777 u_int64_t off;
778 size_t len;
779 int r, handle, fd, ret, status;
780 u_char *data;
781
782 if ((r = get_handle(iqueue, &handle)) != 0 ||
783 (r = sshbuf_get_u64(iqueue, &off)) != 0 ||
784 (r = sshbuf_get_string(iqueue, &data, &len)) != 0)
785 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
786
787 debug("request %u: write \"%s\" (handle %d) off %llu len %zu",
788 id, handle_to_name(handle), handle, (unsigned long long)off, len);
789 fd = handle_to_fd(handle);
790
791 if (fd < 0)
792 status = SSH2_FX_FAILURE;
793 else {
794 if (!(handle_to_flags(handle) & O_APPEND) &&
795 lseek(fd, off, SEEK_SET) < 0) {
796 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
797 error("process_write: seek failed");
798 } else {
799/* XXX ATOMICIO ? */
800 ret = write(fd, data, len);
801 if (ret < 0) {
802 error("process_write: write failed");
803 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
804 } else if ((size_t)ret == len) {
805 status = SSH2_FX_OK;
806 handle_update_write(handle, ret);
807 } else {
808 debug2("nothing at all written");
809 status = SSH2_FX_FAILURE;
810 }
811 }
812 }
813 send_status(id, status);
814 free(data);
815}
816
817static void
818process_do_stat(u_int32_t id, int do_lstat)
819{
820 Attrib a;
821 struct stat st;
822 char *name;
823 int r, status = SSH2_FX_FAILURE;
824
825 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(iqueue, &name, NULL)) != 0)
826 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
827
828 debug3("request %u: %sstat", id, do_lstat ? "l" : "");
829 verbose("%sstat name \"%s\"", do_lstat ? "l" : "", name);
830 r = do_lstat ? lstat(name, &st) : stat(name, &st);
831 if (r < 0) {
832 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
833 } else {
834 stat_to_attrib(&st, &a);
835 send_attrib(id, &a);
836 status = SSH2_FX_OK;
837 }
838 if (status != SSH2_FX_OK)
839 send_status(id, status);
840 free(name);
841}
842
843static void
844process_stat(u_int32_t id)
845{
846 process_do_stat(id, 0);
847}
848
849static void
850process_lstat(u_int32_t id)
851{
852 process_do_stat(id, 1);
853}
854
855static void
856process_fstat(u_int32_t id)
857{
858 Attrib a;
859 struct stat st;
860 int fd, r, handle, status = SSH2_FX_FAILURE;
861
862 if ((r = get_handle(iqueue, &handle)) != 0)
863 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
864 debug("request %u: fstat \"%s\" (handle %u)",
865 id, handle_to_name(handle), handle);
866 fd = handle_to_fd(handle);
867 if (fd >= 0) {
868 r = fstat(fd, &st);
869 if (r < 0) {
870 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
871 } else {
872 stat_to_attrib(&st, &a);
873 send_attrib(id, &a);
874 status = SSH2_FX_OK;
875 }
876 }
877 if (status != SSH2_FX_OK)
878 send_status(id, status);
879}
880
881static struct timeval *
882attrib_to_tv(const Attrib *a)
883{
884 static struct timeval tv[2];
885
886 tv[0].tv_sec = a->atime;
887 tv[0].tv_usec = 0;
888 tv[1].tv_sec = a->mtime;
889 tv[1].tv_usec = 0;
890 return tv;
891}
892
893static struct timespec *
894attrib_to_ts(const Attrib *a)
895{
896 static struct timespec ts[2];
897
898 ts[0].tv_sec = a->atime;
899 ts[0].tv_nsec = 0;
900 ts[1].tv_sec = a->mtime;
901 ts[1].tv_nsec = 0;
902 return ts;
903}
904
905static void
906process_setstat(u_int32_t id)
907{
908 Attrib a;
909 char *name;
910 int r, status = SSH2_FX_OK;
911
912 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(iqueue, &name, NULL)) != 0 ||
913 (r = decode_attrib(iqueue, &a)) != 0)
914 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
915
916 debug("request %u: setstat name \"%s\"", id, name);
917 if (a.flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_SIZE) {
918 logit("set \"%s\" size %llu",
919 name, (unsigned long long)a.size);
920 r = truncate(name, a.size);
921 if (r == -1)
922 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
923 }
924 if (a.flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_PERMISSIONS) {
925 logit("set \"%s\" mode %04o", name, a.perm);
926 r = chmod(name, a.perm & 07777);
927 if (r == -1)
928 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
929 }
930 if (a.flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_ACMODTIME) {
931 char buf[64];
932 time_t t = a.mtime;
933
934 strftime(buf, sizeof(buf), "%Y%m%d-%H:%M:%S",
935 localtime(&t));
936 logit("set \"%s\" modtime %s", name, buf);
937 r = utimes(name, attrib_to_tv(&a));
938 if (r == -1)
939 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
940 }
941 if (a.flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_UIDGID) {
942 logit("set \"%s\" owner %lu group %lu", name,
943 (u_long)a.uid, (u_long)a.gid);
944 r = chown(name, a.uid, a.gid);
945 if (r == -1)
946 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
947 }
948 send_status(id, status);
949 free(name);
950}
951
952static void
953process_fsetstat(u_int32_t id)
954{
955 Attrib a;
956 int handle, fd, r;
957 int status = SSH2_FX_OK;
958
959 if ((r = get_handle(iqueue, &handle)) != 0 ||
960 (r = decode_attrib(iqueue, &a)) != 0)
961 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
962
963 debug("request %u: fsetstat handle %d", id, handle);
964 fd = handle_to_fd(handle);
965 if (fd < 0)
966 status = SSH2_FX_FAILURE;
967 else {
968 char *name = handle_to_name(handle);
969
970 if (a.flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_SIZE) {
971 logit("set \"%s\" size %llu",
972 name, (unsigned long long)a.size);
973 r = ftruncate(fd, a.size);
974 if (r == -1)
975 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
976 }
977 if (a.flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_PERMISSIONS) {
978 logit("set \"%s\" mode %04o", name, a.perm);
979 r = fchmod(fd, a.perm & 07777);
980 if (r == -1)
981 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
982 }
983 if (a.flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_ACMODTIME) {
984 char buf[64];
985 time_t t = a.mtime;
986
987 strftime(buf, sizeof(buf), "%Y%m%d-%H:%M:%S",
988 localtime(&t));
989 logit("set \"%s\" modtime %s", name, buf);
990 r = futimes(fd, attrib_to_tv(&a));
991 if (r == -1)
992 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
993 }
994 if (a.flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_UIDGID) {
995 logit("set \"%s\" owner %lu group %lu", name,
996 (u_long)a.uid, (u_long)a.gid);
997 r = fchown(fd, a.uid, a.gid);
998 if (r == -1)
999 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
1000 }
1001 }
1002 send_status(id, status);
1003}
1004
1005static void
1006process_opendir(u_int32_t id)
1007{
1008 DIR *dirp = NULL;
1009 char *path;
1010 int r, handle, status = SSH2_FX_FAILURE;
1011
1012 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(iqueue, &path, NULL)) != 0)
1013 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1014
1015 debug3("request %u: opendir", id);
1016 logit("opendir \"%s\"", path);
1017 dirp = opendir(path);
1018 if (dirp == NULL) {
1019 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
1020 } else {
1021 handle = handle_new(HANDLE_DIR, path, 0, 0, dirp);
1022 if (handle < 0) {
1023 closedir(dirp);
1024 } else {
1025 send_handle(id, handle);
1026 status = SSH2_FX_OK;
1027 }
1028
1029 }
1030 if (status != SSH2_FX_OK)
1031 send_status(id, status);
1032 free(path);
1033}
1034
1035static void
1036process_readdir(u_int32_t id)
1037{
1038 DIR *dirp;
1039 struct dirent *dp;
1040 char *path;
1041 int r, handle;
1042
1043 if ((r = get_handle(iqueue, &handle)) != 0)
1044 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1045
1046 debug("request %u: readdir \"%s\" (handle %d)", id,
1047 handle_to_name(handle), handle);
1048 dirp = handle_to_dir(handle);
1049 path = handle_to_name(handle);
1050 if (dirp == NULL || path == NULL) {
1051 send_status(id, SSH2_FX_FAILURE);
1052 } else {
1053 struct stat st;
1054 char pathname[PATH_MAX];
1055 Stat *stats;
1056 int nstats = 10, count = 0, i;
1057
1058 stats = xcalloc(nstats, sizeof(Stat));
1059 while ((dp = readdir(dirp)) != NULL) {
1060 if (count >= nstats) {
1061 nstats *= 2;
1062 stats = xreallocarray(stats, nstats, sizeof(Stat));
1063 }
1064/* XXX OVERFLOW ? */
1065 snprintf(pathname, sizeof pathname, "%s%s%s", path,
1066 strcmp(path, "/") ? "/" : "", dp->d_name);
1067 if (lstat(pathname, &st) < 0)
1068 continue;
1069 stat_to_attrib(&st, &(stats[count].attrib));
1070 stats[count].name = xstrdup(dp->d_name);
1071 stats[count].long_name = ls_file(dp->d_name, &st, 0, 0);
1072 count++;
1073 /* send up to 100 entries in one message */
1074 /* XXX check packet size instead */
1075 if (count == 100)
1076 break;
1077 }
1078 if (count > 0) {
1079 send_names(id, count, stats);
1080 for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
1081 free(stats[i].name);
1082 free(stats[i].long_name);
1083 }
1084 } else {
1085 send_status(id, SSH2_FX_EOF);
1086 }
1087 free(stats);
1088 }
1089}
1090
1091static void
1092process_remove(u_int32_t id)
1093{
1094 char *name;
1095 int r, status = SSH2_FX_FAILURE;
1096
1097 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(iqueue, &name, NULL)) != 0)
1098 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1099
1100 debug3("request %u: remove", id);
1101 logit("remove name \"%s\"", name);
1102 r = unlink(name);
1103 status = (r == -1) ? errno_to_portable(errno) : SSH2_FX_OK;
1104 send_status(id, status);
1105 free(name);
1106}
1107
1108static void
1109process_mkdir(u_int32_t id)
1110{
1111 Attrib a;
1112 char *name;
1113 int r, mode, status = SSH2_FX_FAILURE;
1114
1115 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(iqueue, &name, NULL)) != 0 ||
1116 (r = decode_attrib(iqueue, &a)) != 0)
1117 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1118
1119 mode = (a.flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_PERMISSIONS) ?
1120 a.perm & 07777 : 0777;
1121 debug3("request %u: mkdir", id);
1122 logit("mkdir name \"%s\" mode 0%o", name, mode);
1123 r = mkdir(name, mode);
1124 status = (r == -1) ? errno_to_portable(errno) : SSH2_FX_OK;
1125 send_status(id, status);
1126 free(name);
1127}

1129static void
1130process_rmdir(u_int32_t id)
1131{
1132 char *name;
1133 int r, status;
1134
1135 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(iqueue, &name, NULL)) != 0)
1136 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1137
1138 debug3("request %u: rmdir", id);
1139 logit("rmdir name \"%s\"", name);
1140 r = rmdir(name);
1141 status = (r == -1) ? errno_to_portable(errno) : SSH2_FX_OK;
1142 send_status(id, status);
1143 free(name);
1144}
1145
1146static void
1147process_realpath(u_int32_t id)
1148{
1149 char resolvedname[PATH_MAX];
1150 char *path;
1151 int r;
1152
1153 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(iqueue, &path, NULL)) != 0)
1154 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1155
1156 if (path[0] == '\0') {
1157 free(path);
1158 path = xstrdup(".");
1159 }
1160 debug3("request %u: realpath", id);
1161 verbose("realpath \"%s\"", path);
1162 if (realpath(path, resolvedname) == NULL) {
1163 send_status(id, errno_to_portable(errno));
1164 } else {
1165 Stat s;
1166 attrib_clear(&s.attrib);
1167 s.name = s.long_name = resolvedname;
1168 send_names(id, 1, &s);
1169 }
1170 free(path);
1171}
1172
1173static void
1174process_rename(u_int32_t id)
1175{
1176 char *oldpath, *newpath;
1177 int r, status;
1178 struct stat sb;
1179
1180 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(iqueue, &oldpath, NULL)) != 0 ||
1181 (r = sshbuf_get_cstring(iqueue, &newpath, NULL)) != 0)
1182 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1183
1184 debug3("request %u: rename", id);
1185 logit("rename old \"%s\" new \"%s\"", oldpath, newpath);
1186 status = SSH2_FX_FAILURE;
1187 if (lstat(oldpath, &sb) == -1)
1188 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
1189 else if (S_ISREG(sb.st_mode)) {
1190 /* Race-free rename of regular files */
1191 if (link(oldpath, newpath) == -1) {
1192 if (errno == EOPNOTSUPP) {
1193 struct stat st;
1194
1195 /*
1196 * fs doesn't support links, so fall back to
1197 * stat+rename. This is racy.
1198 */
1199 if (stat(newpath, &st) == -1) {
1200 if (rename(oldpath, newpath) == -1)
1201 status =
1202 errno_to_portable(errno);
1203 else
1204 status = SSH2_FX_OK;
1205 }
1206 } else {
1207 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
1208 }
1209 } else if (unlink(oldpath) == -1) {
1210 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
1211 /* clean spare link */
1212 unlink(newpath);
1213 } else
1214 status = SSH2_FX_OK;
1215 } else if (stat(newpath, &sb) == -1) {
1216 if (rename(oldpath, newpath) == -1)
1217 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
1218 else
1219 status = SSH2_FX_OK;
1220 }
1221 send_status(id, status);
1222 free(oldpath);
1223 free(newpath);
1224}
1225
1226static void
1227process_readlink(u_int32_t id)
1228{
1229 int r, len;
1230 char buf[PATH_MAX];
1231 char *path;
1232
1233 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(iqueue, &path, NULL)) != 0)
1234 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1235
1236 debug3("request %u: readlink", id);
1237 verbose("readlink \"%s\"", path);
1238 if ((len = readlink(path, buf, sizeof(buf) - 1)) == -1)
1239 send_status(id, errno_to_portable(errno));
1240 else {
1241 Stat s;
1242
1243 buf[len] = '\0';
1244 attrib_clear(&s.attrib);
1245 s.name = s.long_name = buf;
1246 send_names(id, 1, &s);
1247 }
1248 free(path);
1249}
1250
1251static void
1252process_symlink(u_int32_t id)
1253{
1254 char *oldpath, *newpath;
1255 int r, status;
1256
1257 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(iqueue, &oldpath, NULL)) != 0 ||
1258 (r = sshbuf_get_cstring(iqueue, &newpath, NULL)) != 0)
1259 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1260
1261 debug3("request %u: symlink", id);
1262 logit("symlink old \"%s\" new \"%s\"", oldpath, newpath);
1263 /* this will fail if 'newpath' exists */
1264 r = symlink(oldpath, newpath);
1265 status = (r == -1) ? errno_to_portable(errno) : SSH2_FX_OK;
1266 send_status(id, status);
1267 free(oldpath);
1268 free(newpath);
1269}
1270
1271static void
1272process_extended_posix_rename(u_int32_t id)
1273{
1274 char *oldpath, *newpath;
1275 int r, status;
1276
1277 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(iqueue, &oldpath, NULL)) != 0 ||
1278 (r = sshbuf_get_cstring(iqueue, &newpath, NULL)) != 0)
1279 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1280
1281 debug3("request %u: posix-rename", id);
1282 logit("posix-rename old \"%s\" new \"%s\"", oldpath, newpath);
1283 r = rename(oldpath, newpath);
1284 status = (r == -1) ? errno_to_portable(errno) : SSH2_FX_OK;
1285 send_status(id, status);
1286 free(oldpath);
1287 free(newpath);
1288}
1289
1290static void
1291process_extended_statvfs(u_int32_t id)
1292{
1293 char *path;
1294 struct statvfs st;
1295 int r;
1296
1297 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(iqueue, &path, NULL)) != 0)
1298 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1299 debug3("request %u: statvfs", id);
1300 logit("statvfs \"%s\"", path);
1301
1302 if (statvfs(path, &st) != 0)
1303 send_status(id, errno_to_portable(errno));
1304 else
1305 send_statvfs(id, &st);
1306 free(path);
1307}
1308
1309static void
1310process_extended_fstatvfs(u_int32_t id)
1311{
1312 int r, handle, fd;
1313 struct statvfs st;
1314
1315 if ((r = get_handle(iqueue, &handle)) != 0)
1316 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1317 debug("request %u: fstatvfs \"%s\" (handle %u)",
1318 id, handle_to_name(handle), handle);
1319 if ((fd = handle_to_fd(handle)) < 0) {
1320 send_status(id, SSH2_FX_FAILURE);
1321 return;
1322 }
1323 if (fstatvfs(fd, &st) != 0)
1324 send_status(id, errno_to_portable(errno));
1325 else
1326 send_statvfs(id, &st);
1327}
1328
1329static void
1330process_extended_hardlink(u_int32_t id)
1331{
1332 char *oldpath, *newpath;
1333 int r, status;
1334
1335 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(iqueue, &oldpath, NULL)) != 0 ||
1336 (r = sshbuf_get_cstring(iqueue, &newpath, NULL)) != 0)
1337 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1338
1339 debug3("request %u: hardlink", id);
1340 logit("hardlink old \"%s\" new \"%s\"", oldpath, newpath);
1341 r = link(oldpath, newpath);
1342 status = (r == -1) ? errno_to_portable(errno) : SSH2_FX_OK;
1343 send_status(id, status);
1344 free(oldpath);
1345 free(newpath);
1346}
1347
1348static void
1349process_extended_fsync(u_int32_t id)
1350{
1351 int handle, fd, r, status = SSH2_FX_OP_UNSUPPORTED;
1352
1353 if ((r = get_handle(iqueue, &handle)) != 0)
1354 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1355 debug3("request %u: fsync (handle %u)", id, handle);
1356 verbose("fsync \"%s\"", handle_to_name(handle));
1357 if ((fd = handle_to_fd(handle)) < 0)
1358 status = SSH2_FX_NO_SUCH_FILE;
1359 else if (handle_is_ok(handle, HANDLE_FILE)) {
1360 r = fsync(fd);
1361 status = (r == -1) ? errno_to_portable(errno) : SSH2_FX_OK;
1362 }
1363 send_status(id, status);
1364}
1365
1366static void
1367process_extended_lsetstat(u_int32_t id)
1368{
1369 Attrib a;
1370 char *name;
1371 int r, status = SSH2_FX_OK;
1372
1373 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(iqueue, &name, NULL)) != 0 ||
1374 (r = decode_attrib(iqueue, &a)) != 0)
1375 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1376
1377 debug("request %u: lsetstat name \"%s\"", id, name);
1378 if (a.flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_SIZE) {
1379 /* nonsensical for links */
1380 status = SSH2_FX_BAD_MESSAGE;
1381 goto out;
1382 }
1383 if (a.flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_PERMISSIONS) {
1384 logit("set \"%s\" mode %04o", name, a.perm);
1385 r = fchmodat(AT_FDCWD, name,
1386 a.perm & 07777, AT_SYMLINK_NOFOLLOW);
1387 if (r == -1)
1388 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
1389 }
1390 if (a.flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_ACMODTIME) {
1391 char buf[64];
1392 time_t t = a.mtime;
1393
1394 strftime(buf, sizeof(buf), "%Y%m%d-%H:%M:%S",
1395 localtime(&t));
1396 logit("set \"%s\" modtime %s", name, buf);
1397 r = utimensat(AT_FDCWD, name,
1398 attrib_to_ts(&a), AT_SYMLINK_NOFOLLOW);
1399 if (r == -1)
1400 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
1401 }
1402 if (a.flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_UIDGID) {
1403 logit("set \"%s\" owner %lu group %lu", name,
1404 (u_long)a.uid, (u_long)a.gid);
1405 r = fchownat(AT_FDCWD, name, a.uid, a.gid,
1406 AT_SYMLINK_NOFOLLOW);
1407 if (r == -1)
1408 status = errno_to_portable(errno);
1409 }
1410 out:
1411 send_status(id, status);
1412 free(name);
1413}
1414
1415static void
1416process_extended(u_int32_t id)
1417{
1418 char *request;
1419 int i, r;
1420
1421 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(iqueue, &request, NULL)) != 0)
1422 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1423 for (i = 0; extended_handlers[i].handler != NULL; i++) {
1424 if (strcmp(request, extended_handlers[i].ext_name) == 0) {
1425 if (!request_permitted(&extended_handlers[i]))
1426 send_status(id, SSH2_FX_PERMISSION_DENIED);
1427 else
1428 extended_handlers[i].handler(id);
1429 break;
1430 }
1431 }
1432 if (extended_handlers[i].handler == NULL) {
1433 error("Unknown extended request \"%.100s\"", request);
1434 send_status(id, SSH2_FX_OP_UNSUPPORTED); /* MUST */
1435 }
1436 free(request);
1437}
1438
1439/* stolen from ssh-agent */
1440
1441static void
1442process(void)
1443{
1444 u_int msg_len;
1445 u_int buf_len;
1446 u_int consumed;
1447 u_char type;
1448 const u_char *cp;
1449 int i, r;
1450 u_int32_t id;
1451
1452 buf_len = sshbuf_len(iqueue);
1453 if (buf_len < 5)
1454 return; /* Incomplete message. */
1455 cp = sshbuf_ptr(iqueue);
1456 msg_len = get_u32(cp);
1457 if (msg_len > SFTP_MAX_MSG_LENGTH) {
1458 error("bad message from %s local user %s",
1459 client_addr, pw->pw_name);
1460 sftp_server_cleanup_exit(11);
1461 }
1462 if (buf_len < msg_len + 4)
1463 return;
1464 if ((r = sshbuf_consume(iqueue, 4)) != 0)
1465 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1466 buf_len -= 4;
1467 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u8(iqueue, &type)) != 0)
1468 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1469
1470 switch (type) {
1471 case SSH2_FXP_INIT:
1472 process_init();
1473 init_done = 1;
1474 break;
1475 case SSH2_FXP_EXTENDED:
1476 if (!init_done)
1477 fatal("Received extended request before init");
1478 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u32(iqueue, &id)) != 0)
1479 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1480 process_extended(id);
1481 break;
1482 default:
1483 if (!init_done)
1484 fatal("Received %u request before init", type);
1485 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u32(iqueue, &id)) != 0)
1486 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1487 for (i = 0; handlers[i].handler != NULL; i++) {
1488 if (type == handlers[i].type) {
1489 if (!request_permitted(&handlers[i])) {
1490 send_status(id,
1491 SSH2_FX_PERMISSION_DENIED);
1492 } else {
1493 handlers[i].handler(id);
1494 }
1495 break;
1496 }
1497 }
1498 if (handlers[i].handler == NULL)
1499 error("Unknown message %u", type);
1500 }
1501 /* discard the remaining bytes from the current packet */
1502 if (buf_len < sshbuf_len(iqueue)) {
1503 error("iqueue grew unexpectedly");
1504 sftp_server_cleanup_exit(255);
1505 }
1506 consumed = buf_len - sshbuf_len(iqueue);
1507 if (msg_len < consumed) {
1508 error("msg_len %u < consumed %u", msg_len, consumed);
1509 sftp_server_cleanup_exit(255);
1510 }
1511 if (msg_len > consumed &&
1512 (r = sshbuf_consume(iqueue, msg_len - consumed)) != 0)
1513 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1514}
1515
1516/* Cleanup handler that logs active handles upon normal exit */
1517void
1518sftp_server_cleanup_exit(int i)
1519{
1520 if (pw != NULL && client_addr != NULL) {
1521 handle_log_exit();
1522 logit("session closed for local user %s from [%s]",
1523 pw->pw_name, client_addr);
1524 }
1525 _exit(i);
1526}
1527
1528__dead static void
1529sftp_server_usage(void)
1530{
1531 extern char *__progname;
1532
1533 fprintf(stderr,
1534 "usage: %s [-ehR] [-d start_directory] [-f log_facility] "
1535 "[-l log_level]\n\t[-P blacklisted_requests] "
1536 "[-p whitelisted_requests] [-u umask]\n"
1537 " %s -Q protocol_feature\n",
1538 __progname, __progname);
1539 exit(1);
1540}
1541
1542int
1543sftp_server_main(int argc, char **argv, struct passwd *user_pw)
1544{
1545 fd_set *rset, *wset;
1546 int i, r, in, out, max, ch, skipargs = 0, log_stderr = 0;
1547 ssize_t len, olen, set_size;
1548 SyslogFacility log_facility = SYSLOG_FACILITY_AUTH;
1549 char *cp, *homedir = NULL, uidstr[32], buf[4*4096];
1550 long mask;
1551
1552 extern char *optarg;
1553 extern char *__progname;
1554
1555 ssh_malloc_init(); /* must be called before any mallocs */
1556 log_init(__progname, log_level, log_facility, log_stderr);
1557
1558 pw = pwcopy(user_pw);
1559
1560 while (!skipargs && (ch = getopt(argc, argv,
1561 "d:f:l:P:p:Q:u:cehR")) != -1) {
1562 switch (ch) {
1563 case 'Q':
1564 if (strcasecmp(optarg, "requests") != 0) {
1565 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid query type\n");
1566 exit(1);
1567 }
1568 for (i = 0; handlers[i].handler != NULL; i++)
1569 printf("%s\n", handlers[i].name);
1570 for (i = 0; extended_handlers[i].handler != NULL; i++)
1571 printf("%s\n", extended_handlers[i].name);
1572 exit(0);
1573 break;
1574 case 'R':
1575 readonly = 1;
1576 break;
1577 case 'c':
1578 /*
1579 * Ignore all arguments if we are invoked as a
1580 * shell using "sftp-server -c command"
1581 */
1582 skipargs = 1;
1583 break;
1584 case 'e':
1585 log_stderr = 1;
1586 break;
1587 case 'l':
1588 log_level = log_level_number(optarg);
1589 if (log_level == SYSLOG_LEVEL_NOT_SET)
1590 error("Invalid log level \"%s\"", optarg);
1591 break;
1592 case 'f':
1593 log_facility = log_facility_number(optarg);
1594 if (log_facility == SYSLOG_FACILITY_NOT_SET)
1595 error("Invalid log facility \"%s\"", optarg);
1596 break;
1597 case 'd':
1598 cp = tilde_expand_filename(optarg, user_pw->pw_uid);
1599 snprintf(uidstr, sizeof(uidstr), "%llu",
1600 (unsigned long long)pw->pw_uid);
1601 homedir = percent_expand(cp, "d", user_pw->pw_dir,
1602 "u", user_pw->pw_name, "U", uidstr, (char *)NULL);
1603 free(cp);
1604 break;
1605 case 'p':
1606 if (request_whitelist != NULL)
1607 fatal("Permitted requests already set");
1608 request_whitelist = xstrdup(optarg);
1609 break;
1610 case 'P':
1611 if (request_blacklist != NULL)
1612 fatal("Refused requests already set");
1613 request_blacklist = xstrdup(optarg);
1614 break;
1615 case 'u':
1616 errno = 0;
1617 mask = strtol(optarg, &cp, 8);
1618 if (mask < 0 || mask > 0777 || *cp != '\0' ||
1619 cp == optarg || (mask == 0 && errno != 0))
1620 fatal("Invalid umask \"%s\"", optarg);
1621 (void)umask((mode_t)mask);
1622 break;
1623 case 'h':
1624 default:
1625 sftp_server_usage();
1626 }
1627 }
1628
1629 log_init(__progname, log_level, log_facility, log_stderr);
1630
1631 if ((cp = getenv("SSH_CONNECTION")) != NULL) {
1632 client_addr = xstrdup(cp);
1633 if ((cp = strchr(client_addr, ' ')) == NULL) {
1634 error("Malformed SSH_CONNECTION variable: \"%s\"",
1635 getenv("SSH_CONNECTION"));
1636 sftp_server_cleanup_exit(255);
1637 }
1638 *cp = '\0';
1639 } else
1640 client_addr = xstrdup("UNKNOWN");
1641
1642 logit("session opened for local user %s from [%s]",
1643 pw->pw_name, client_addr);
1644
1645 in = STDIN_FILENO;
1646 out = STDOUT_FILENO;
1647
1648 max = 0;
1649 if (in > max)
1650 max = in;
1651 if (out > max)
1652 max = out;
1653
1654 if ((iqueue = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
1655 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
1656 if ((oqueue = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
1657 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
1658
1659 rset = xcalloc(howmany(max + 1, NFDBITS), sizeof(fd_mask));
1660 wset = xcalloc(howmany(max + 1, NFDBITS), sizeof(fd_mask));
1661
1662 if (homedir != NULL) {
1663 if (chdir(homedir) != 0) {
1664 error("chdir to \"%s\" failed: %s", homedir,
1665 strerror(errno));
1666 }
1667 }
1668
1669 set_size = howmany(max + 1, NFDBITS) * sizeof(fd_mask);
1670 for (;;) {
1671 memset(rset, 0, set_size);
1672 memset(wset, 0, set_size);
1673
1674 /*
1675 * Ensure that we can read a full buffer and handle
1676 * the worst-case length packet it can generate,
1677 * otherwise apply backpressure by stopping reads.
1678 */
1679 if ((r = sshbuf_check_reserve(iqueue, sizeof(buf))) == 0 &&
1680 (r = sshbuf_check_reserve(oqueue,
1681 SFTP_MAX_MSG_LENGTH)) == 0)
1682 FD_SET(in, rset);
1683 else if (r != SSH_ERR_NO_BUFFER_SPACE)
1684 fatal("%s: sshbuf_check_reserve failed: %s",
1685 __func__, ssh_err(r));
1686
1687 olen = sshbuf_len(oqueue);
1688 if (olen > 0)
1689 FD_SET(out, wset);
1690
1691 if (select(max+1, rset, wset, NULL, NULL) < 0) {
1692 if (errno == EINTR)
1693 continue;
1694 error("select: %s", strerror(errno));
1695 sftp_server_cleanup_exit(2);
1696 }
1697
1698 /* copy stdin to iqueue */
1699 if (FD_ISSET(in, rset)) {
1700 len = read(in, buf, sizeof buf);
1701 if (len == 0) {
1702 debug("read eof");
1703 sftp_server_cleanup_exit(0);
1704 } else if (len < 0) {
1705 error("read: %s", strerror(errno));
1706 sftp_server_cleanup_exit(1);
1707 } else if ((r = sshbuf_put(iqueue, buf, len)) != 0) {
1708 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s",
1709 __func__, ssh_err(r));
1710 }
1711 }
1712 /* send oqueue to stdout */
1713 if (FD_ISSET(out, wset)) {
1714 len = write(out, sshbuf_ptr(oqueue), olen);
1715 if (len < 0) {
1716 error("write: %s", strerror(errno));
1717 sftp_server_cleanup_exit(1);
1718 } else if ((r = sshbuf_consume(oqueue, len)) != 0) {
1719 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s",
1720 __func__, ssh_err(r));
1721 }
1722 }
1723
1724 /*
1725 * Process requests from client if we can fit the results
1726 * into the output buffer, otherwise stop processing input
1727 * and let the output queue drain.
1728 */
1729 r = sshbuf_check_reserve(oqueue, SFTP_MAX_MSG_LENGTH);
1730 if (r == 0)
1731 process();
1732 else if (r != SSH_ERR_NO_BUFFER_SPACE)
1733 fatal("%s: sshbuf_check_reserve: %s",
1734 __func__, ssh_err(r));
1735 }
1736}
